metadata.feature_description: Manages file extensions that are allowed to be indexed and crawled by the search system

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View list of all included extensions

steps.action: Navigated to Site Settings > Search > File Extensions
steps.expected: List of included file extensions should be displayed with File Extension, File Type, and Content Crawling columns
steps.actual: List displayed showing 6 extensions (.doc, .docx, .pdf, .ppt, .pptx, .xls) with their IFilter information and content crawling status

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add new included file extension with leading dot (.txt)

steps.expected: Add form should appear with File Extension text input
steps.actual: Form appeared with text input field, Cancel and Save buttons

steps.action: Entered '.txt' in the File Extension field and clicked Save
steps.expected: Extension should be added with IFilter information displayed
steps.actual: .txt was successfully added with 'Plain Text filter' as File Type and content crawling enabled

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add duplicate included extension and verify error

steps.expected: Error message should be displayed indicating duplicate extension
steps.actual: Error toast appeared (500 error in console, Error element visible in DOM). Extension was not added - .txt appears only once in the list

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add extension not in whitelist and verify error

steps.action: Clicked 'Add File Type' and entered '.xyz' (non-whitelisted extension)
steps.expected: Error should be displayed for non-whitelisted extension
steps.actual: Error toast appeared. Form remained open, extension was not added to the list

steps.action: Clicked Save with empty File Extension field
steps.expected: Form should handle empty input appropriately
steps.actual: Form closed without adding any extension. No empty extension was added to the list
Confirmation dialog displayed: 'Are you sure you want to delete .txt?' with No/Yes buttons

steps.expected: .txt should be removed from the list
steps.actual: .txt was successfully removed. List now shows 6 extensions (without .txt)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify IFilter information display for extensions

steps.action: Observed IFilter information display in the list
steps.expected: Each extension should show File Type (IFilter name) and Content Crawling status
steps.actual: IFilter info displayed correctly: .doc/.ppt/.xls show 'Microsoft Office Filter', .docx shows 'Wordpad DOCX Filter', .pdf/.pptx show warning icon indicating content crawling unavailable (no IFilter installed)

steps.action: Entered 'txt' without leading dot in File Extension field
steps.actual: Validation error icon (!) appeared on input field with red border. Form stayed open after clicking Save - extension was not added

observations: Error toasts appear briefly and auto-dismiss, making them difficult to capture in screenshots
The UI shows appropriate IFilter information when available, and displays a warning icon for extensions without available content crawling
Validation for extension format (requiring leading dot) is performed client-side with visual feedback
